column4: si have a newbie question, my processor is P M which is i686, but the kernel version is 2.6.10-5-386 for i386, thats fine right?
oh ok
thx u both
err i don even have a gig of ram
lol
only one application can access the sound card at once, how can i set it so multiple app can access the sound card?
this is why 'esd' runs in the background - it multiplexes sound output from many apps to the one card.
I assume you're running Gnome?
yes im running gnome
which apps in particular?
most Gnome apps should work OK with esd.
like if i run real player n xmms, while real is play xmms cant
how do i install esd
should be running by default when you log in.
type 'ps -A | grep esd' to see if esd is running.
got this:   8334 ?        00:00:00 esd
ok, so it's running for you.
you need to see if realplayer can use 'esd' as it's output.
although I doubt it understands about esd...
xmms does understand about esd though.
how i do check for esd
in real
one sec - let me install it.
output is 'eSound Output Plugin'
